results.title: You and I, Horizontal II
results.material_description: computer, computer script, projector and  haze machine
results.brief_description:
Step into a dark haze-filled room to interact with the power of projected light. Transforming a beam of light into a three-dimensional sculpture, Anthony McCall’s ‘You and I, Horizontal II’ (2006) is an Australian premiere.

The pioneering work of British-born artist Anthony McCall occupies a space between sculpture, cinema, performance and drawing. McCall was one of the first visual artists to experiment with spatial film and temporal sculpture, emerging in the mid 1970s with the ‘Solid Light’ film series - works that used a 16mm projector to project cones of light through smoke or haze filled rooms. His work attracted renewed attention in the 1990s, when spatial installations once again became a popular and critical tendency in contemporary art. He now uses digital projection and complex graphic software systems to capture the most basic sensory element of the moving image: the projection of light.

results.title: You and hydatids
results.creator_credit: Norman Laird and Tasmanian State Film Unit
results.brief_description: Warns against the danger of humans contracting hydatids through the careless handling of sheep and dog. Explains how, by eating offal from infected animals, the dog becomes the carrier of the disease between sheep and man. The disease my be prevented from spreading by boiling sheep offal prior to feeding to dogs, by carefully washing all vegetables to be eating raw by keeping the dog outside the home and car and by giving the dog regular medical examinations.

results.title: You've Probably Saved His Life
results.creator_credit: Tristram Miall, Film Australia and Karl McPhee
results.brief_description: A dramatised documentary starring Judy Morris and Ivor Kants which is designed to motivate the general public to learn life saving skills such as cardio-vascular resuscitation. A beloved father and husband dies of an acute heart attack. His life could have been saved had his friends and neighbours known how to resuscitate him. An extremely moving film which should be viewed at home, by community and welfare groups, hospitals and schools. This film saves lives.

results.title: You've got to start somewhere
results.creator_credit: Trout Films, Chris Warner and Maureen McCarthy
results.brief_description: Focuses on a multicultural project at Ferntree Gully Primary School to show what teachers at schools with low migrant populations can do to put the philosophy of education in a multicultural society into practice.

results.title: You've got mail
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Lauren Shuler and Nora Ephron
results.brief_description: This story brings romance and courtship (as well as Meg Ryan, Tom Hanks and director Nora Ephron for the third time) into the age of the World Wide Web via email and chat rooms. Joe and Kathleen have a lot in common, they live near each other, they are both in the publishing industry, he in supersized book department stores - Foxbooks, and she in a small independent one - Shop Around the Corner, they even buy coffee at the same place. They have not met in person as yet, but they have met one another in a chat room where they bare their thoughts about life, work and their significant others who are less than perfect. Pretty soon NY152 and Shop Girl want to meet in person, which leads to inevitable angst when two soul mates discover they are business rivals. Cast also includes Parker Posey and Greg Kinnear.

results.title: You're under arrest!: or a citizen's rights and the police
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Adam Symansky and Peter Katadotis
results.brief_description: Claude-Armand Sheppard, a Montreal lawyer, discusses citizens’ rights in dealings with the police. He uses an authentic case where trumped-up charges were twice laid against a citizen. He went to court, was acquitted and then sued for damages. Failure to do so would eventually lead to the erosion of civil rights. Animated drawings lend visual impact to the lawyer’s words. This film is a must for everyone.

results.title: You're the Top: The Cole Porter Story
results.creator_credit: Kirk D'Amico, VPI-Videfilm Productions International, WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.), Channel 4 and Allan Albert
results.brief_description: A glorious celebration of one of the world’s most loved song-writers. The many facets of Porter’s persona and music are presented in the film by friends and colleagues who include Gene Kelly, Bob Hope, Cyd Charisse and Dionne Warwick. Songs featured include “I get a kick out of you”, “I love Paris”, “Night and day” and “Let’s do it, let’s fall in love”. The film also includes excerpts from some of Hollywood’s most popular musicals.
